hanzi-su-wiki:
軸

Значения

Ось, стержень; картина (в свитке); счётный суффикс для рулонов и свитков

Мнемоника

Растения завершаются плодом 由, а телега 車 — осью.

Варианты

轴
purpleculture_pinyin:
zhóu
axis; axle; spool (for thread); roller (for scrolls); classifier for calligraphy rolls etc
ось; ось; катушка (для ниток); ролик (для свитков); классификатор каллиграфических рулетов и др.

zhòu
see 压轴戏 [ya1 zhou4 xi4]; Taiwan pr. [zhou2]
см. 压轴 戏 [ya1 zhou4 xi4]; Тайвань пр. [zhou2]

purpleculture_examples:
軸心 [ zhóu xīn ]: axle; (fig.) central element; key element; axis (alliance of nations)
軸承 [ zhóu chéng ]: (mechanical) bearing

purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 車 [ chē ] cart, vehicle; to move in a cart
    • 由 [ yóu ] cause, reason; from
heisig_chinese_memo: Imagine a car going across a plain at a fast speed. Suddenly a single sprout (the only one to be seen) gets stuck to the car's axle, causing the car to fly around its axis.
Keyword_KANJIDIC: axis, pivot, stem, stalk, counter for book scrolls
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: ось, стержень, стебель, стебель, счетчик для книжных завитков
koohiiStory1: The Germans manufactured so many cars during World War II that it was almost as if they were sprouting from the factories of the Axis.
koohiiStory2: An absurd image, but what the heck - worked for me. Imagine a car going across a plain at a fast speed. Suddenly a single sprout (the only one to be seen) gets stuck to the car´s wheels, causing the car to fly around its axis.
jp_example_words: 軸(じく): axis, stem, shaft, axle
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: For a car, the reason why it works is because it has an axis that it is built on. If it doesn't have that, it won't work at all.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine a car without an axis on it. Not a car that will work too well.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You see a car without an axis and it's your friend's car. He's all like "isn't this a cool car?" You reply: "Gee, cool" (じく) very sarcastically.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: You're super sarcastic about this, so feel the sarcasm inside of you when you imagine this.
Ru_Meaning: axis, pivot, stem, stalk, counter for book scrolls
Ru_trainchinese:
zhóu: (сущ/сч.слово) вал, ось; предмет в форме вала; ось (координат); катушка, валик; свиток (о картине), катушка (ниток)
zhòu: (графема) см. 压轴
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the reason (由) cars (車) work is that they have an axis
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Imagine a car going across a plain at a fast speed.  Suddenly a single sprout gets stuck to the axle, causing the car to fly around its axis.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " car ", " a voice." The original meaning is the axle, the long wood connecting the middle of the wheel. "Said Wen": "Axle, hold the wheel. From the car, from the sound." Zhang Shunhui's note: "The shaft runs through the two hubs under the ground, and both ends are out of the hub. The straight wood is used as it, and it follows the wheel Turning endlessly." Such as "Pipe. "Riding a Horse": "Manshan, its wood can be used as a material, can be a shaft." Biography of Fan Sui and Cai Ze: "My horse is sick, and the axle is broken. If it is not a big cart, I can't get out of it."

" Axes " generally refers to things that can rotate, such as "Salt Iron Theory. "Xing De": "The former Wu made Zaiwei hold the shaft and broke his ship, and the Qin made Zhao Gao take the bridle and overturn his car." " Axle " means the rudder. Another example is "Fayan. "The Prophet": "If the dirty person is old, the lonely person, the sick alone, the deceased, the fields are barren, and the shaft is empty." " Shaft " means weaving. Another example is Bai Juyi's "Pipa Xing" in the Tang Dynasty: "The rotating shaft plucks the strings three or two times, and the tune is first sentimental." The " axis " refers to a device that twists the strings on an instrument.

" Axis " is extended to mean center and hub. Such as "Han Shu. "Gongsun Liu Tian Wang Yang Cai Chen Zheng Chuan": "The prime minister is in the ranks of Yilu, when the axis is in the middle, the bag is not said, and he goes away." Tang Dynasty Han Yu "Leave Xiangyang Li Xianggong in Wine": "Knowing the public Soon he will return to Jun Zhou and promise Xian Guan to send him sick."

" Shaft " also refers to a scroll, that is, a round rod at the lower end of ancient paintings and calligraphy that is convenient for hanging or rolling up, and also refers to the scrolls of calligraphy and painting. Such as "Sui Shu. "Jing Ji Zhi": "Song Wu entered the customs, collected his pictures and books, all in the house, only four thousand volumes. The red scroll is on blue paper, and the writing is ancient." Tang Dynasty Ling Gu Chu "Plain by General Xie Ci": "Household treasure scroll People are influenced by Lun Yan." It is also used as a measure word, such as Yan Zhenqing of the Tang Dynasty "Zhang Changshi's Twelve Ideas of Brushwork": "Danshu has dozens of scrolls, screens, and plain elements. Write, calligraphy should be self-understanding."

" Axis " also means illness. "The Book of Songs. Wei Feng. "Kao Pan": "Kao Pan is in Lu, the axis of the master." Zheng Xuanjian: "The axis is sick."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " car ", " a voice." The original meaning is the axle, the long wood connecting the middle of the wheel.
humanum_full_description:
從「車」，「由」聲。本義是輪軸，即連接車輪中間的長木。《說文》：「軸，持輪也。从車，由聲。」張舜徽約注：「軸在輿下貫兩轂，而兩端皆出轂外，以直木為之，隨輪之行而轉動不已。」如《管子．乘馬》：「蔓山，其木可以為材，可以為軸。」《史記．范睢蔡澤列傳》：「吾馬病，車軸折，非大車駟馬，吾固不出。」

　　「軸」又泛指可以旋轉之物，如《鹽鐵論．刑德》：「昔吳使宰嚭持軸而破其舩，秦使趙高執轡而覆其車。」「軸」表示船舵。又如《法言．先知》：「若污人老，屈人孤，病者獨，死者逋，田畝荒，杼軸空之謂斁。」「軸」表示織具。又如唐代白居易〈琵琶行〉：「轉軸撥弦三兩聲，未成曲調先有情。」「軸」指樂器上扭動弦線的裝置。

　　「軸」引申表示中心、樞紐。如《漢書．公孫劉田王楊蔡陳鄭傳》：「丞相履伊呂之列，當軸處中，括囊不言，容身而去。」唐代韓愈〈酒中留上襄陽李相公〉：「知公不久歸鈞軸，應許閒官寄病身。」

　　「軸」也表示卷軸，即古代書畫下端便於懸掛或捲起的圓杆，亦指裝成卷軸的書畫。如《隋書．經籍志》：「宋武入關，收其圖籍，府藏所有，纔四千卷。赤軸青紙，文字古拙。」唐代令孤楚〈為人謝賜將軍官告狀〉：「家藏寶軸，人受綸言。」又作量詞，如唐代顏真卿〈張長史十二意筆法記〉：「但書得絹、屏、素數十軸，亦嘗論諸筆法，唯言倍加工學臨寫，書法當自悟耳。」

　　「軸」還表示病。《詩經．衛風．考槃》：「考槃在陸，碩人之軸。」鄭玄箋：「軸，病也。」
humanum_short_description: 從「車」，「由」聲。本義是輪軸，即連接車輪中間的長木。

軸軸RS
轴轴 		axle, axletree, pivot, axis
  • the piece that sticks out 由 of the wheel 車
(Simplified: 轴)
Pictophonetic: 由 indicates the sound; 車 (wheel) conveys the meaning.
  • Chinese Definition:
  • Chinese Definition:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 車 [ chē ] cart, vehicle; to move in a cart
    • 由 [ yóu ] cause, reason; from
①穿在輪子中間的圓柱形物件：軸心。輪軸。
②像車軸的用來卷繞東西的圓柱形器物：畫軸。卷軸。
③量詞，古代用於以軸裝成的書卷，現用於纏在軸上的線以及裝裱帶軸子的字畫等：“鄴侯家多書，插架三萬軸”。兩軸絲線。
④紡織機上持經線的工具：杼軸。
⑤樞要的地位：當軸(ａ．當權，官居要職；b．居要職的官)。
⑥數學上指一條直線，周圍的點圍繞它旋轉，或是用它作爲確定各點位置的標準：轉動軸。座標軸。
軸心 [ zhóu xīn ]: axle; (fig.) central element; key element; axis (alliance of nations)
軸承 [ zhóu chéng ]: (mechanical) bearing
軸線 [ zhóu xiàn ]: central axis (line)
①見“壓軸子”yāzhòzi。
(Simplified: 轴)

軸(じく): axis, stem, shaft, axle

從「 車 」，「 由 」聲。本義是輪軸，即連接車輪中間的長木。《說文》：「軸，持輪也。从車，由聲。」張舜徽約注：「軸在輿下貫兩轂，而兩端皆出轂外，以直木為之，隨輪之行而轉動不已。」如《管子．乘馬》：「蔓山，其木可以為材，可以為軸。」《史記．范睢蔡澤列傳》：「吾馬病，車軸折，非大車駟馬，吾固不出。」 「 軸 」又泛指可以旋轉之物，如《鹽鐵論．刑德》：「昔吳使宰嚭持軸而破其舩，秦使趙高執轡而覆其車。」「 軸 」表示船舵。又如《法言．先知》：「若污人老，屈人孤，病者獨，死者逋，田畝荒，杼軸空之謂斁。」「 軸 」表示織具。又如唐代白居易〈琵琶行〉：「轉軸撥弦三兩聲，未成曲調先有情。」「 軸 」指樂器上扭動弦線的裝置。 「 軸 」引申表示中心、樞紐。如《漢書．公孫劉田王楊蔡陳鄭傳》：「丞相履伊呂之列，當軸處中，括囊不言，容身而去。」唐代韓愈〈酒中留上襄陽李相公〉：「知公不久歸鈞軸，應許閒官寄病身。」 「 軸 」也表示卷軸，即古代書畫下端便於懸掛或捲起的圓杆，亦指裝成卷軸的書畫。如《隋書．經籍志》：「宋武入關，收其圖籍，府藏所有，纔四千卷。赤軸青紙，文字古拙。」唐代令孤楚〈為人謝賜將軍官告狀〉：「家藏寶軸，人受綸言。」又作量詞，如唐代顏真卿〈張長史十二意筆法記〉：「但書得絹、屏、素數十軸，亦嘗論諸筆法，唯言倍加工學臨寫，書法當自悟耳。」 「 軸 」還表示病。《詩經．衛風．考槃》：「考槃在陸，碩人之軸。」鄭玄箋：「軸，病也。」
From the " car", " a voice." The original meaning is the axle, the long wood connecting the middle of the wheel. "Said Wen": "Axle, hold the wheel. From the car, from the sound." Zhang Shunhui's note: "The shaft runs through the two hubs under the ground, and both ends are out of the hub. The straight wood is used as it, and it follows the wheel Turning endlessly." Such as "Pipe. "Riding a Horse": "Manshan, its wood can be used as a material, can be a shaft." Biography of Fan Sui and Cai Ze: "My horse is sick, and the axle is broken. If it is not a big cart, I can't get out of it." " Axes" generally refers to things that can rotate, such as "Salt Iron Theory. "Xing De": "The former Wu made Zaiwei hold the shaft and broke his ship, and the Qin made Zhao Gao take the bridle and overturn his car." " Axle" means the rudder. Another example is "Fayan. "The Prophet": "If the dirty person is old, the lonely person, the sick alone, the deceased, the fields are barren, and the shaft is empty." " Shaft" means weaving. Another example is Bai Juyi's "Pipa Xing" in the Tang Dynasty: "The rotating shaft plucks the strings three or two times, and the tune is first sentimental." The " axis" refers to a device that twists the strings on an instrument. " Axis" is extended to mean center and hub. Such as "Han Shu. "Gongsun Liu Tian Wang Yang Cai Chen Zheng Chuan": "The prime minister is in the ranks of Yilu, when the axis is in the middle, the bag is not said, and he goes away." Tang Dynasty Han Yu "Leave Xiangyang Li Xianggong in Wine": "Knowing the public Soon he will return to Jun Zhou and promise Xian Guan to send him sick." " Shaft" also refers to a scroll, that is, a round rod at the lower end of ancient paintings and calligraphy that is convenient for hanging or rolling up, and also refers to the scrolls of calligraphy and painting. Such as "Sui Shu. "Jing Ji Zhi": "Song Wu entered the customs, collected his pictures and books, all in the house, only four thousand volumes. The red scroll is on blue paper, and the writing is ancient." Tang Dynasty Ling Gu Chu "Plain by General Xie Ci": "Household treasure scroll People are influenced by Lun Yan." It is also used as a measure word, such as Yan Zhenqing of the Tang Dynasty "Zhang Changshi's Twelve Ideas of Brushwork": "Danshu has dozens of scrolls, screens, and plain elements. Write, calligraphy should be self-understanding." " Axis" also means illness. "The Book of Songs. Wei Feng. "Kao Pan": "Kao Pan is in Lu, the axis of the master." Zheng Xuanjian: "The axis is sick."

軸字的基本解释

軸
zhóu

軸
zhòu
均见“轴”。

軸字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhóu］
［《廣韻》直六切，入屋，澄。］
“轴1”的繁体字。
(1)轮轴，即贯于毂中持轮旋转的圆柱形长杆。
(2)指机械中圆柱形的零件。用来支持其他转动的零件。
(3)车子。
(4)輁轴。支棺的工具。
(5)舵，船。
(6)织具。
(7)谓枢要之地位。
(8)喻贯串事物的中心。
(9)弦乐器上用以转动调节弦的部件。
(10)字画下端便于悬挂或卷起的圆杆。亦指装成卷轴形的书、画。
(11)卷起。
(12)量词。计算绕在轴上的线状物及装裱带轴的字画数量的单位。
(13)同“逐”。病。
(14)同“逐”。奔驰，驰逐。
(15)数学名词。指把平面或立体分成对称部分的直线。
(16)古地名。
[②]［zhòu］
“轴2”的繁体字。
见“軸2子”。

軸字的康熙字典解释

【酉集下】【車字部】　軸； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页1242第13
【廣韻】【正韻】直六切【集韻】【韻會】仲六切，?音逐。【說文】持輪。【釋名】軸，抽也。入轂中可抽出也。　又織具。【詩·小雅】杼軸其空。【註】杼，持緯者。軸，受經者。　又卷軸。【韓愈詩】鄴侯家多書，插架三萬軸。　又乾軸、地軸，皆取旋運輪轉之意。【袁宏·三國名臣贊】?廻乾軸。【木華·海賦】地軸挺拔而爭廻。　又當軸，秉國政也。【前漢·田千秋傳】當軸處中。　又病不能行也。【詩·衞風】碩人之軸。【箋】病也。【註】盤桓不行之意。　又地名。【詩·鄭風】淸人在軸。【註】軸，河上衞地。　【集韻】一作?。

axis
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zhóu］
["Guangyun" has six straight cuts, enters the house, and is clear. ]
Traditional characters for "轴1".
(1) Axle, that is, a cylindrical long rod that runs through the hub and holds the wheel for rotation.
(2) Refers to cylindrical parts in machinery. Used to support other rotating parts.
(3) The car.
(4) Min axis. Tools for supporting coffins.
(5) Rudder, ship.
(6) Weaving tools.
(7) The status of the pivot.
(8) Yu runs through the center of things.
(9) The part used to rotate and adjust the strings on a stringed instrument.
(10) A round rod at the lower end of the calligraphy and painting that is convenient for hanging or rolling up. It also refers to the scroll-shaped books and paintings.
(11) Roll up.
(12) Quantifiers. A unit for calculating the number of linear objects wound on the shaft and the number of calligraphy and paintings mounted on the shaft.
(13) Same as "by". disease.
(14) The same as "by". Mercedes-Benz, racing.
(15) Mathematical terms. Refers to a straight line that divides a plane or solid into symmetrical parts.
(16) Ancient place names.
[②]［zhòu］
"Axis 2" in traditional characters.
See "Axis 2".

axis
Name meaning
Nothing.
zhóu, zhòu
вм. 轴
Radicals: 車, 由  (car, reason)
Meaning Mnemonic
For a car, the reason why it works is because it has an axis that it is built on. If it doesn't have that, it won't work at all.
Imagine a car without an axis on it. Not a car that will work too well.
Reading Mnemonic
You see a car without an axis and it's your friend's car. He's all like "isn't this a cool car?" You reply: "Gee, cool" (じく) very sarcastically.
You're super sarcastic about this, so feel the sarcasm inside of you when you imagine this.
